alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Lawrence; Washington (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 06 at 9:27PM EDT until April 08 at 3:12PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River at Seymour. White River at Elliston....and at Edwardsport down to Petersburg. .Following areas of one to two inches of rainfall on Wednesday... lowland, minor flooding along the East Fork White River...continues at Seymour...while on the White River minor flooding has resumed at Elliston...and continues at Edwardsport and points downriver. The crest on the East Fork White River has passed Seymour...yet this slowly passing crest is expected to hold Lawrence County points in action stage to near bankfull into early next week. The White River is forecast to crest this weekend. Flooding is expected to continue on the East Fork White River at Seymour into Saturday...while aforementioned points on the White River should remain in minor flood into next week. Minor flooding primarily impacts local river roads, parks, and agricultural land. Dry conditions are expected through next week... which will allow the lowest portions of the White River to crest and fall below flood by next weekend. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...East Fork White River at Seymour. * WHEN...Until Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Pasture lands, agricultural lands and several county and state roads begin to flood. High water isolates a few river cabins. State Road 235 east of Medora and county roads near Shields and Vallonia flood. Roads that begin to flood include SR 258 east of Cortland, CR 725 N just north of the gaging site and Ewing Road near Brownstown. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 13.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 PM EDT Thursday was 14.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Saturday morning and continue falling to 6.2 feet Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated by noon Friday.
